item.title: Histograms
item.description: Histograms In this blog I will be demonstrating the art behind creating a histogram in RStudo. The first step is to bring i the packages we will need using the library command: library(sqldf) library(Lahman) library(ggplot2) Step two is extracting the data. In this example we are looking at the body weight distribution of baseball players. We can get this information by using an sqldf query search. Step three is visualizing the data.

item.title: Scatter Plots
item.description: Scatter Plots library(sqldf) library(Lahman) library(ggplot2) # extracting data ---------------- query<-"SELECT playerID,sum(HR) AS career_HR,sum(SO) AS career_SO FROM Batting GROUP BY playerID HAVING sum(HR)>=400" result<-sqldf(query) #visualizing the data -------------- ggplot()+ geom_point(data=result,aes(x=career_SO,y=career_HR),size=3,color="blue")+ ggtitle("Career Strikeouts vs Homeruns for Great Hitters")+ xlab("career strikeouts")+ ylab("career homeruns")
